Subject: overloading of Cantera::Domain1D routines
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=202312840; y=gJSTZq5cP0KAy7Tg5N0FhXM00CqmMqrBnUIAvXfAlEz5j6k

Hello,

I'm currently working on a code based on C++ Cantera::Domain1D classes.
Cantera is truly a great platform for this, as it's fairly simple to
overload class functions and thus run cases with modified physics.

I'm trying to keep my modified code separate from the main Cantera
infrastructure, and have been fairly successful thus far. (The main
reason is that I can run off a widely unmaintained Cantera installation
on our server.)

Now I've run into the issue that I cannot overload
Domain1D::initTimeInteg (in File Domain1D.h), as it is not declared
virtual. Making this routine overloadable would not change the
performance of the code and help me (and others) use this great software
package even better.

Regards,
-Ingmar-

PS: On that note I'd also like to point out that StFlow::componentIndex
(in file StFlow.h/cpp) is obsolete, and currently not even called, as
the base class routine is not overloaded correctly.
